params.taskDescription:
If <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>b</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>25</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">b = 25</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>c</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>65</mn>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext> ft</mtext>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">c = 65{\text{ ft}}</annotation></semantics></math>, find <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>a</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">a</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.taskDescription:
If <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>b</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>12</mn>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext> cm</mtext>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">b = 12{\text{ cm}}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>c</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>15</mn>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext> cm</mtext>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">c = 15{\text{ cm}}</annotation></semantics></math>, find <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>a</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">a</annotation></semantics></math>.

questionSetStimulus:
Use the Pythagorean theorem to answer the following exercises. Let <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>a</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">a</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>b</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">b</annotation></semantics></math> represent two legs of a right triangle, and let <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>c</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">c</annotation></semantics></math> represent the hypotenuse. Find the lengths of the missing sides.
